Utilities to help with tests that involve files or directories.

toHexString

public static String toHexString(long l)
Convert a long to it's hex representation. Unlike this always returns 16 digits.

Parameters:
l - The long to convert.
Returns:
l in hex.

createTmpDirectory

public static File createTmpDirectory(File parent,
                                      String prefix,
                                      String suffix)
                               throws IOException
Create a temporary directory.

Parameters:
parent - The parent directory for the temporary directory. If this is null, the system property "java.io.tmpdir" is used.
prefix - The prefix for the directory's name. If this is null, the full class name of this class is used.
suffix - The suffix for the directory's name. If this is null, ".tmp" is used.
Returns:
The newly created temporary directory.
Throws:
IOException - if directory creation fails
SecurityException - if File.mkdir() throws one.

createTmpDirectory

public static File createTmpDirectory(String prefix)
                               throws IOException
Create a temporary directory. This calls createTmpDirectory(File, String, String) with null for parent and suffix.

Parameters:
prefix - The prefix for the directory's name. If this is null, the full class name of this class is used.
Returns:
The newly created temporary directory.
Throws:
IOException - if directory creation fails
SecurityException - if File.mkdir() throws one.

createTmpDirectory

public static File createTmpDirectory()
                               throws IOException
Create a temporary directory. This calls createTmpDirectory(File, String, String) with null for all arguments.

Returns:
The newly created temporary directory.
Throws:
IOException - if directory creation fails
SecurityException - if File.mkdir() throws one.

isChildSubDirectory

public static boolean isChildSubDirectory(File parent,
                                          File child)
                                   throws IOException
Checks that child is a directory and really a child of parent. This verifies that the canonical child is actually a child of parent. This should fail if the child is a symbolic link to another directory and therefore should not be traversed in a recursive traversal of a directory.

Parameters:
parent - The supposed parent of the child
child - The child to check
Returns:
true if child is a directory and a direct decendant of parent.
Throws:
IOException - if File.getCanonicalFile() does
NullPointerException - if either parent or child are null.

delete

public static void delete(File file)
                   throws IOException
Delete a file. Unlinke File.delete(), this throws an exception if deletion fails.

Parameters:
file - The file to delete
Throws:
IOException - if file is not null, exists but delete fails.

deleteRecursively

public static void deleteRecursively(File file)
                              throws IOException
Recursively delete a file. If file is a directory, subdirectories and files are also deleted. Care is taken to not traverse symbolic links in this process. A null file or a file that does not exist is considered to already been deleted.

Parameters:
file - The file or directory to be deleted
Throws:
IOException - if the file, or a descendant, cannot be deleted.
SecurityException - if File.delete() does.
